intro: Gnaphalium calviceps, commonly known as the hairy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Its leaves are usually hairy and narrow, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The species is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
